name: Shrimp Cakes with Old Bay®
author: ERam21
summary: I have always loved crab cakes and I had some leftover cooked shrimp so I decided to mix it up a bit with Old Bay® seasoning and they turned out to be awesome!
ingredients: 1 pound cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined
½ cup diced red bell pepper
½ cup diced green bell pepper
directions: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to low
Place shrimp in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until shredded
Transfer shrimp to a large bowl and add bread crumbs, bell peppers, seafood seasoning, parsley flakes, salt, pepper, onion salt, Italian seasoning, and dry mustard; mix until well combined
Mix egg, mayonnaise, and hot sauce together in a small bowl
Add to shrimp mixture and mix until fully incorporated
Form into 5 patties and place on a baking sheet
Place under the preheated broiler for 5 minutes
Turn broiler to high and cook until tops are well browned, about 5 minutes longer
Flip shrimp cakes and broil on high until the other sides are browned, about 5 more minutes
